qas.question: Standards of behaviour used by an individual, which are considered to be morally right, are:
An example of acceptable outdoor ethical behaviour
answers: Keeping your fire in your firepit only
Randomly killing snakes because they hiss at you
Cutting new trails with your vehicle
Tearing down old buildings for firewood

qas.question: A positive public attitude towards hunting is important if the opportunities for hunting are to be maintained
An ethical hunter will shoot over his or her daily bag limit to help fill their hunting partner's bag limit
If you shoot a game animal and it runs away
answers: Wait for 10-15 minutes before pursuing the animal
Forget it and look for another game animal to shoot
Take a few shots into the bush before going after the animal

qas.question: After an animal is shot and is dead, before handling it, you must:
A freshly killed animal should never be displayed in public because:
